action.action-desc: Mr. Bera (for himself and Mr. Smith of Missouri) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide that coverage under Medicare is permissible for purposes of contributions to health savings accounts.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Health Savings for Seniors Act.

section.header: Coverage under Medicare permissible for purposes of contributions to health savings accounts

paragraph.text: Subparagraph (A) of section 223(c)(2) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to read as follows:

subparagraph.text: The term HSA-qualified health plan means—

subclause.text: which has an annual deductible which is not less than—

item.text: twice the dollar amount in item (aa) for family coverage, and

subclause.text: the sum of the annual deductible and the other annual out-of-pocket expenses required to be paid under the plan (other than for premiums) for covered benefits does not exceed—

item.text: twice the dollar amount in item (aa) for family coverage, and

clause.text: in the case of an individual enrolled under title XVIII of the Social Security Act, coverage under title XVIII of such Act.

paragraph.text: Paragraph (1) of section 223(c) of such Code is amended by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.header: Special rule for individuals enrolled in Medicare
subparagraph.text: An individual enrolled under title XVIII of the Social Security Act shall not fail to be treated as an eligible individual for any period merely because the individual during such period is covered under a health plan described in subclauses (I) and (II) of subparagraph (A)(ii).

paragraph.header: Exclusion of Medicare premiums as qualified medical expense
paragraph.text: Subparagraph (C) of section 223(d)(2) of such Code is amended by inserting or at the end of clause (ii), by striking or at the end of clause (iii) and inserting a period, and by striking clause (iv).

paragraph.header: Repeal of exception to additional tax after Medicare eligibility
paragraph.text: Paragraph (4) of section 223(f) of such Code is amended by striking subparagraph (C).

subparagraph.text: Section 223 of such Code is amended by striking “high deductible health plan” each place it appears in the text and inserting “HSA-qualified health plan”.

clause.text: The heading for paragraph (2) of section 223(c) of such Code is amended by striking “High deductible health plan” and inserting “HSA-qualified health plan”.
Section 408(d)(9) of such Code is amended—

subclause.text: by striking “high deductible health plan” each place it appears in the text in subparagraph (C) and inserting “HSA-qualified health plan”; and
by striking “High deductible health plan” in the heading of subparagraph (D) and inserting “HSA-qualified health plan”.

clause.text: Section 106(e) of such Code is amended—

subclause.text: by striking “High deductible health plan” in the heading of paragraph (3) and inserting “HSA-qualified health plan”; and
by striking “high deductible health plan” in paragraph (5)(B)(ii) and inserting “HSA-qualified health plan”.

subsection.header: Repeal of Medicare limitation on deduction for contributions

paragraph.text: Subsection (b) of section 223 of such Code is amended by striking paragraph (7) and redesignating paragraph (8) as paragraph (7).
Section 26(b)(2)(S) of such Code is amended by striking 223(b)(8)(B)(i)(II), and inserting 223(b)(7)(B)(i)(II),.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act.
